perturbation.original_text: THIS AGREEMENT made this 5th day of December, 2007, between R. C. Boyd Enterprises, LLC, a Texas limited liability company, whose principal  place of business is located at 2003 Navasota Cove, Westlake, Texas, referred to in this Agreement as "Company" or "Boyd", and Cano Petroleum,  Inc., a Delaware corporation qualified to transact business in Texas, whose principal place of business is located at 801 Cherry Street, Suite 3200,  Fort Worth, Texas 76102, referred to in this agreement as "Sponsor" or "Cano".
perturbation.changed_text: THIS AGREEMENT made this 5th day of December, 2007, between R. C. Boyd Enterprises, LLC, a Texas limited liability company, whose principal place of business is located at 2003 Navasota Cove, Westlake, Texas, referred to in this Agreement as "Company" or "Boyd", and Cano Petroleum, Inc., a Delaware corporation qualified to transact business in Texas, whose principal place of business is located at 801 Cherry Street, Suite 3200, Fort Worth, Texas 76102, referred to in this agreement as "Advertiser" or "Cano".
perturbation.explanation: The agreement initially defines Cano Petroleum, Inc. as "Sponsor" or "Cano". This change replaces "Sponsor" with "Advertiser", creating uncertainty as to the role and obligations of Cano Petroleum, Inc. Later mentions of "Sponsor" may now be ambiguous.

perturbation.original_text: WHEREAS, Sponsor desires to acquire the exclusive right to be the lead sponsor of the Show at an agreed price and under specified terms and  conditions;
perturbation.changed_text: WHEREAS, Advertiser desires to acquire the exclusive right to be the title sponsor of the Show at an agreed price and under specified terms and conditions;
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'lead sponsor' to 'title sponsor' creates an ambiguity. It is unclear whether 'lead sponsor' and 'title sponsor' have the same meaning, potentially affecting the scope of rights Cano acquires. Also, referring to the Company now as "Advertiser", which conflicts with the 'Sponsor' definition later in the document, causes confusion.

perturbation.original_text: The Company agrees that Cano shall be entitled to place signage, up to 6 feet × 10 feet at each public appearance made by Honey Hole, including four (4) "Kids Corner" children's benefits during the term of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company agrees that Cano shall be entitled to place advertisements, up to 6 feet × 10 feet at each public appearance made by Honey Hole, including four (4) "Kids Corner" children's benefits during the term of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'signage' to 'advertisements' introduces a subtle shift that could lead to disputes. 'Signage' typically refers to brand displays, whereas 'advertisements' encompass a broader range of promotional materials. This lack of clarity can cause problems in interpreting the allowable promotional activities for CANO.
